properties.areaDesc: Santa Fe Metro Area; Northwest Highlands; Upper Rio Grande Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley/Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains; Espanola Valley
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 4:48AM MST until January 17 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOW TO THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS AND
A WINTRY MIX TO PORTIONS OF THE EASTERN PLAINS TODAY...TONIGHT AND
INTO FRIDAY...

.A complex winter storm system will bring accumulating snow to
northern New Mexico. The highest snow accumulations will be found
above 7500 feet with accumulations ranging from 5 to 10 inches
and over a foot possible on mountain peaks. Very strong westerly
winds on Friday will also create areas of reduced visibilities in
blowing snow across the northern high terrain. Areas of freezing
rain will be possible across portions of mainly the east central
plains this morning and again this evening. For the latest New
Mexico road conditions call 511 or visit nmroads.com.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4
inches.

* WHERE...Northwest and West Central Highlands, West Central
Mountains, Upper and Middle Rio Grande Valley Including the
Albuquerque Metro Area, Espanola Valley and the Santa Fe Metro
Area.

* WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highway 550 and Interstate 40 over the
Continental Divide will be impacted as well as Highway 285 from
Santa Fe north to the Colorado state line.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST FRIDAY
